channel.title: Check Object spawn to do multiple spots?
channel.description:
public void checkObjectSpawn(int objectId, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int objectType) c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1597, 3005, 3323, 0, 10);
thats my checkobjectspawn ok so what im wanting to be able to do is make it do instead of just the x being 3005 and y being 3323 like just that spot i want to be able to make multiple of that object spawn like spawn a square of that object
like if this were just a regular checkobjectspawn and "-" was the object: - and then i change it to this c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1597, 3005 through 3010, 3323, 0, 10) : -----
hopefully yall understand what i mean then also how would i make the object spawn on a certain height level like if i only wanted an object to spawn on height level 2

item.title: Check Object spawn to do multiple spots?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461

item.title: Check Object spawn to do multiple spots?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:520456”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=638954.msg4307092#msg4307092 date=1370058752]
ok i did it but its weird its like it chooses when it wants to show up, ya know? man why cant this stuff just work lol
[/quote]
Sounds like there’s client to server lag.[/quote]

hm yea, i dont know what to do, maybe its something todo with the way it loads custom spawned objects, is there a way to spawn objects client sided or something to make it faster?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

add an else if statement.

        else if (c.heightLevel != 1) {
                        c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(-1, XXXX, YYYY, FACE, Type);
                 }

I had the object id, x, and y mixed.

i tried this but then it started spawning on other height levels as well

item.source: Check Object spawn to do multiple spots?

item.title: Check Object spawn to do multiple spots?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

java doesnt work like that. Height wise, you need to make client edits as well.

wait you’re saying i need to make client changes to make it were when i spawn an object on the server side using checkobjectspawn it will spawn it on a certain height level? is there anyway i can make a new one like this:

[code] public void checkObjectSpawnH(int objectId, int objectX, int objectY, int objectHeight, int face, int objectType) {
if (c.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) > 60)
return;
if (c.getOutStream() != null && c != null) {
c.getOutStream().createFrame(85);
c.getOutStream().writeByteC(objectY - (c.getMapRegionY() * 8));
c.getOutStream().writeByteC(objectX - (c.getMapRegionX() * 8));
c.getOutStream().writeByte(objectHeight);
c.getOutStream().createFrame(101);
c.getOutStream().writeByteC((objectType << 2) + (face & 3));
c.getOutStream().writeByte(0);

		if (objectId != -1) {
			c.getOutStream().createFrame(151);
			c.getOutStream().writeByteS(0);
			c.getOutStream().writeWordBigEndian(objectId);
			c.getOutStream().writeByteS((objectType << 2) + (face & 3));
		}
		c.flushOutStream();
	}
}[/code]

i tried this but when i add it in client says some errors then logs me out

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:520456”]I’m confused here?
Are you trying to make objects spawn on floor 1 and 2?[/quote]

i just want the object to spawn on floor 2/height level 2

[quote=“Arcik, post:2, topic:520456”]I THINK THIS IS WHAT YOU MEAN!

I’m trolling btw this isnt how you should do it nor do I recommend using this only because it is poor code and not how should be doing it

[code=java]public void spawnObjectBoxThingy(int objectId, int x, int y, int face, int objectType) {
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x, y, 0, 10);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 1, y + 1, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 2, y + 2, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 3, y + 3, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 4, y + 4, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 5, y + 5, face, objectType);

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 1, y - 1, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 2, y - 2, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 3, y - 3, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 4, y - 4, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 5, y - 5, face, objectType);

}[/code]

So what you would do is… spawnObjectBoxThingy(1597, 3012, 2049, 0, 10); and it would spawn the object all round your char :)[/quote]

spawnobjectboxthingy…? your kidding right

Read full topic

item.title: Check Object spawn to do multiple spots?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I THINK THIS IS WHAT YOU MEAN!

I’m trolling btw this isnt how you should do it nor do I recommend using this only because it is poor code and not how should be doing it

[code=java]public void spawnObjectBoxThingy(int objectId, int x, int y, int face, int objectType) {
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x, y, 0, 10);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 1, y + 1, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 2, y + 2, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 3, y + 3, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 4, y + 4, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x + 5, y + 5, face, objectType);

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 1, y - 1, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 2, y - 2, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 3, y - 3, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 4, y - 4, face, objectType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(objectId, x - 5, y - 5, face, objectType);

}[/code]

So what you would do is… spawnObjectBoxThingy(1597, 3012, 2049, 0, 10); and it would spawn the object all round your char
